review_title: Registered Nurse Public Health Field Supervisor
job_title: Registered Nurse Public Health Field Supervisor in Ak-Chin Village, AZ
pros:
I loved my job working among the Indians of the
TOHONO O'ODUM Tribe. This position was the most rewarding position I have held in all 17 years of nursing.
cons: I have no cons. Working for Gila River, the CNO, my fellow co workers and my director were awesome. I just wish I could have stayed, but my family need at home now and I need to return home. My husband died in February and I have no one here in Arizona that is family so therefore, it is time to return home and to a different realm of nursing.

pros: Great pay and benefits free soft drinks & coffee.
cons: Like 3rd world. Very backwoods and uneducated.  Dis -like & dis-trust white people. Always crying with their hand out to state and federal government. Think they know everything and refuse to take advise from white people even though they were hired to guide teach and assist. Even though tribal people have no experience, education.                                                        White employee’s have a target on their back from day one.

review_title: Very high turnover rate in all departments is a sign of ineffective management
pros: Decent health benefits kick in after first year. Management is slowly making strides to treat employees better. some very nice people work here.
cons: Only pays 80% of market median for all wages and refuse to budge. Hiring leans towards nepotism and favortism.  lots of red tape. exeuctive management treats lower level employees like idiots and does not want them to speak out of turn. hourly employees can't have ot without being approved by the director. lunch room full of flies. attendance points system applied to those wo fall out of favor with maangement. new hire orientation classes every two weeks is a bad siggn

pros: Guaranteed 40 hours of work per week.   Schedule was pretty much permanent. 8am-5pm
cons: Employees are very territorial, clickish, and not team players.   Management is a joke they seem to only be there for the paycheck.

pros: Great people liked the people

review_title: Good pay, Good people. Small town politics.
job_title: Network and Computer Administrator in Sacaton, AZ
pros: Good benefits and pay. Indian tacos. Nice people.
cons: No EOE required for the tribe. The tribal politics seam to affect a lot of the aspects of the job. Sacaton where the tribal government and most of the tribal buildings are is not convenient to anything.

The pay is great and the benefits are incredible.
There is plenty if opportunity for advancement

pros: Insurance benefits are awesome, the hours aren't bad, the people are wonderful (coworkers, not management), the pay is good considering you're working in the middle of nowhere.
